newsitem.title: USA: Ore. based Portland Genl rate cut on costs.
newsitem.headline: Ore. based Portland Genl rate cut on costs.

text.p: A proposed rate reduction for Portland General Electric Co's customers was based on cost and revenue shifts which would result from Enron Corp's planned merger with the utility, a member of the Oregon Public Utility Commission staff said on Thursday.
Commission staff have advised that the merger be conditional on a rate cut for Portland General's (PGE) customers of $47.5 million annually for four years.
Under the proposal, the rate cut would then fall to $11.2 million per year until the utility's next rate case.

Mike Myers, OPUC programme manager, said the recommendation was based on cost savings attributed to the merger, compensation for PGE's trading floor which will be absorbed by Enron's and revenue that PGE's trading operations would have generated.
Assets such as the good-will of the utility name were also factored into the rate cut proposal, he said.
The OPUC staff also set conditions such as assurances of service quality for approval of the merger.
OPUC staff are due to make a final merger recommendation by January 31, with the commission scheduled to make its decision on March 17. --D Beasley, Los Angeles bureau (213) 955 6761
